page.title: 03EMIGRATION FROM MONKLANDS
page.content:
which accounted for 48% of those questioned. 31% were attracted by 'a better life', and 19% (mainly female) moved for marriage. Only 4% moved to the EEC nations in spite of free movement and good working conditions.
As a result of these demographic changes, we are left with a substantial ageing population, as many young skilled workers have moved elsewhere. Rising unemployment in other areas and lack of money to travel has slowed the emigration rate recently. The unemployment trend continues to rise and it will lead to serious social and economic problems in the area in the future.
